issue.title: [CF 489] Multiple entries not ignoring invalid entries
issue.body:
It has irked me for a while now that if I build a cooldown icon with multiple entries, the icon will not skip invalid entries.

For example, because I use the same TellMeWhen profile on multiple characters with different levels of equipment I'd like to have an icon that tracks the Vicious, Ruthless and Cataclysmic Gladiator's Medallion of Tenacity. However the only way I can do that right now is by building 3 different icons and then uniting them with a metaicon. If I just input them into the same icon like so: "Vicious Gladiator's Medallion of Tenacity; Ruthless Gladiator's Medallion of Tenacity; Cataclysmic Gladiator's Medallion of Tenacity" the icon will just bug out unless I have the first one in the sequence equipped.

A second example would be when I change my spec. I might want the same icon to track the cooldown of Tree of Life in one spec and Survival Instincts in another.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #489 | Raw

comments.body:
For the item cooldown problem, do you have the "Only if in bags" or "Only if equipped" settings enabled?

For the spell cooldown problem, nothing is going to change there. If you want to track cooldowns from different specs, you need to put them in different icons that have spec conditions.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Only if equipped.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Hmmm, then that means that the setting isn't working the way it is supposed to. I will take a look and fix it.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Could you post the export string for the pvp trinket cooldown? It seems to be working properly for me...


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

It's working now actually. It appears I just made a sloppy mistake and assumed it was the same phenomenon as with multiple spells in the same icon.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer
